now I just heated that the simmering and
I turned it off I just want to kind of
soften that chocolate a little while I
make my burnt caramel so in a pan a dry
pan I'm going to put one tablespoon of
white sugar and over medium-low heat I'm
going to slowly caramelize it and this
is time lapse this took about I don't
know seven or eight minutes now you have
to watch we want this to have a really
intense burnt caramel that's called
burnt caramel it's not burnt you check
it out it looks like a rabbit bird but
we want this to have a really dark
intense dark caramel flavor but we don't
want it black so see when the bubbles
get kind of big at that stage that is
where you want to stop and add your cold
heavy cream slowly carefully pour in the
heavy cream it's going to bubble up
violently and as soon as the sugar is
melted into the cream you're going to
turn off the heat okay so right there
you see the sugar has kind of melted
into the cream and we have a nice dark
caramel sauce you're going to pour that
hot cream sugar mixture over our warmed
slightly softened chocolate remember
there's no heat under the chocolate
anymore I just brought it up to a simmer
and turned it off I'm going to mix that
with my spatula and that is basically a
ganache you saw the same thing when we
made our dark chocolate truffles all
right and once that's all incorporated
you
work not super quickly but kind of
quickly because we got a corpsman here
while it's still nice and soft so I'm
going to drop these by little teaspoons
onto a silicon baking mat I'm going to
top with just a few grains of sea salt
that is the secret to this candy I'm
going to put on a piece of plastic and
just lightly press down with another pan
to flatten those out and then we got to
chill them all right I'm going to put

or in the freezer till they get firm and
when they do you peel right off
look at that so cool chocolate coins all

Michelle prefers them dusted with cocoa
so you know guess what I did

that means the texture was perfect the
